meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, people use shekels to buy things.
meanings.sent2: He counted his shekels carefully before going shopping.
meanings.sent3: The shekels in his pocket jingled as he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than all the shekels in the world.
meanings.sent5: The shekels gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of prosperity.

meanings.sent1: She saved up enough shekels to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: They pooled their shekels to help a friend in need.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled shekels out of his hat instead of coins.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was worth more than any amount of shekels.
meanings.sent5: The shekels clinked together in a satisfying sound of savings.
